thread.title: Meet Suzuki Subramanyam Alias Peter Alias Pakodi
thread.title_full: Meet Suzuki Subramanyam Alias Peter Alias Pakodi

title: Meet Suzuki Subramanyam Alias Peter Alias Pakodi
text:
Email 2 
Apart from the presence of megastar Chiranjeevi, one of the biggest selling points for upcoming Ram Charan-starrer Bruce Lee, is Tollywood’s very own comedy king Brahmanandam. 
Popularly known as Brahmi, the veteran actor’s comedy has been one of the major reasons for the success of Srinu Vaitla’s previous films like Dhee and Ready, a trend which will continue in Bruce Lee, reveal sources from the film’s unit. 
Brahmanandam will be playing a character called Suzuki Subramanyam alias Peter alias Pakodi in the much-awaited film and the makers have assured rib-tickling comedy, which one normally expects from the veteran comedian. 
“Brahmanandam, as usual has done a remarkable job and his performance is certainly going to be one of the highlights of the film,” said director Srinu Vaitla, while adding that the actor is bound to leave the audience in splits. 
A major concern for fans, however, remains the staggering pace at which the film has been completed. The shooting for Bruce Lee started in May and the shoot wrapped by the end of September – after just four months, leaving fans concerned that the rushed manner of filmmaking might compromise the quality of the film. 
Allaying all such fears, the film’s producer DVV Danayya says, “That is not at all a concern. Even though the film was made at a rapid pace, there is no question of compromising on its quality” 
“Had we done that, do you think Chiranjeevi garu would have given his consent to star in the film?,” he adds. 
Directed by Srinu Vaitla, Bruce Lee also features Rakul Preet Singh and is slated to hit screens on October16.
